title: Interpretation Pitfalls in User Testing
description: An interactive four-quadrant infographic that helps students identify and avoid common interpretation pitfalls when analyzing user testing data, including confirmation bias, small sample overgeneralization, correlation/causation confusion, and expert blind spot.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: User Testing
Cognitive Biases
Research Methods
Instructional Design
Usability Evaluation
relation: Part of the Automating Instructional Design intelligent textbook
coverage: Common interpretation errors in user testing and usability evaluation
learningObjective: Help students identify and avoid common interpretation pitfalls when analyzing user testing data
